text: Parinacota or Parina Quta (from Aymara parina flamingo, quta lake, "flamingo lake") is a massive dormant volcano (a stratovolcano) on the border of Chile and Bolivia. ==History== The first ascent of this peak was made by Carlos Terán, Bolivian, and Joseph Prem, Austrian on 12 December 1928. ==Geography== It is part of the Payachata volcanic group formed by the Parinacota together with the Pleistocene peak of Pomerape. The volcano and Pomerape straddle the border between Sajama National Park (Oruro Department, Bolivia) and Lauca National Park (Parinacota Province, Chile). ==Gallery== SajamaPark.jpg|Volcanoes in Sajama National Park (Parinacota and Pomerape) Nevados de payachata parinacota pomerape.jpg|Parinacota and Pomerape volcano Chile lauca parinacota2.jpg|Parinacota and Chungará lake ==Related pages== * List of volcanoes ==References== ==Other websites== * * Andeshandbook: A Complete Description, history, place names and routes of Parinacota * Parinacota at SummitPost.org Category:Andes Category:Geography of Bolivia Category:Volcanoes of Chile Category:Arica y Parinacota Region
title: Parinacota Volcano
